title: Traditional IRA
description: What is a Traditional IRA? A Traditional IRA allows you to contribute pre-tax dollars and grow your money tax deferred. Learn about how to open one today.

For more information, view the [Washington Update](https://www.schwab.com/learn/story/congress-passes-major-boost-to-retirement-savings). Traditional IRA Traditional IRAs can be a smart solution to increase your tax-deferred retirement savings. What is a Traditional IRA? A traditional IRA is an account to which you can contribute pre-tax or after-tax dollars. Your contributions may be tax deductible depending on your situation, helping to give you immediate tax benefits. Why consider a Traditional IRA? With a Traditional IRA, your money can grow tax deferred, but you'll pay ordinary income tax on your withdrawals, and you must start taking distributions after age 73. Unlike with a [Roth IRA](https://www.schwab.com/ira/roth-ira), there are no income limitations to opening a Traditional IRA. It may be a good option for those who expect to be in the same or lower tax bracket in the future. [Learn more about Roth vs. Traditional IRAs](https://www.schwab.com/ira/roth-vs-traditional-ira) and which may be right for you. What benefits do Traditional IRAs provide for your retirement? - Grow potential earnings tax deferred This may be a good option for those who expect to be in the same or lower tax bracket in the future, as you'll pay ordinary income tax on your withdrawals. - No income limitations to opening an account However, there are annual [contribution limits](https://www.schwab.com/ira/traditional-ira/contribution-limits)to the account. - Current year contributions may be tax deductible Depending on your income level or if you don't have an employer-sponsored retirement plan, your contribution may be fully deductible.
